comments.text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; rv:2.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0.1
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; rv:2.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0.1

i clicked a link from within an external program that launched firefox in full screen. the only thing visible was my persona (no tabs visible). i had to leave full screen to see the tabs, then enter full screen again to view the page properly. i have had this bug several times. its like firefox forgets to show the tabs

Reproducible: Sometimes

Steps to Reproduce:
cant remember if firefox was closed or not
1.click link from external program (ccleaner) 
2.firefox starts in full screen mode. no tabs visible
3.
Actual Results:  
worked fine this time

2.firefox starts in full screen mode. no tabs visible
3.
Actual Results:

Can you get a screenshot of what it looks like when the tabs aren't there?

I can't reproduce this myself in Firefox 6 using a link from Chatzilla as the external link.

comments.text:
Works for me on Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; rv:6.0a1) Gecko/20110510 Firefox/6.0a1

Also, could you see if the issue occurs if using Firefox in safe mode:
http://support.mozilla.com/kb/Safe+Mode

How about with a new, empty testing profile? (Don't install any addons into it)
http://support.mozilla.com/kb/Basic+Troubleshooting#w_8-make-a-new-profile

comments.raw_text:
steps to reproduce:

outlook minimized, hide when minimized
firefox not maximized, currently active program
	only 1 tab open
	tabs not visible if only 1 tab open
	all addons disabled and now using only the default firefox theme
Maximize firefox
Click show desktop button on windows taskbar 
Double click on ms outlook icon in taskbar
Outlook opens, not maximized
Click hyperlink in an email
Firefox opens up
no tabs visible
